brief_summary.textblock:
Our past ultrasound research has indicated a need for baseline normative tongue data against
      which to compare our disordered speech populations.  Subjects with normal speech and hearing
      who represent different ages and sexes, will be studied with respect to tongue shape and
      movement patterns.  Recently developed parameters such as curve fitting, curve averaging,
      and polar coordinates will be used to create baseline data categories.  In addition, new
      parameters and improved instruments will be developed as previously to produce a data base
      which can be used across disciplines.

clinical_study.brief_title: Development of Normative Ultrasound Databases of Tongue Surface Configuration

detailed_description.textblock:
Our past ultrasound research has indicated a need for baseline normative tongue data against
      which to compare our disordered speech populations.  Subjects with normal speech and hearing
      who represent different ages and sexes, will be studied with respect to tongue shape and
      movement patterns.  Recently developed parameters such as curve fitting, curve averaging,
      and polar coordinates will be used to create baseline data categories.  In addition, new
      parameters and improved instruments will be developed as previously to produce a data base
      which can be used across disciplines.

criteria.textblock:
Healthy normal subjects.

        No reconstructive tongue surgery.

        No radiation for head and neck malignancy.

clinical_study.official_title: Development of Normative Ultrasound Databases of Tongue Surface Configuration

reference.citation: Sonies BC, Wang C, Sapper DJ. Evaluation of normal and abnormal hyoid bone movement during swallowing by use of ultrasound duplex-Doppler imaging. Ultrasound Med Biol. 1996;22(9):1169-75.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)
